width.description: The new width of the screen in pixels normalised based on the device pixels per inch density (DPI). Example: if a device has a DPI = 2 the width will be divided by 2 to get a normalised width.

height.description: The new height of the screen in pixels normalised based on the device pixels per inch density (DPI). Example: if a device has a DPI = 2 the height will be divided by 2 to get a normalised height.
